IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: KIDS' FOOD BASKET IS NOURISHING KIDS TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL WITH KEY COMMITMENTS TO NOURISH, ENGAGE, LEARN AND GROW.
IRS990.MissionDesc: KIDS' FOOD BASKET IS NOURISHING KIDS TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL WITH KEY COMMITMENTS TO NOURISH, ENGAGE, LEARN AND GROW.
IRS990.Desc: KIDS' FOOD BASKET SACK SUPPER AND VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS NOURISH KIDS TO REACH THIER FULL POTENTIAL. SACK SUPPERS ARE NUTRITIOUS EVENING MEALS DELIVERED WEEKDAYS TO NEARLY 8,800 CHILDREN ACROSS WEST MICHIGAN PRE COVID. EACH MEAL IS PREPARED, PACKED AND DELIVERED WITH THE SUPPORT OF DAILY VOLUNTEERS. VOLUNTEERS PROVIDED MORE THAN 24,600 HOURS OF TIME AND COMMUNITY DONATIONS OF IN-KIND FOOD HELPED US SERVE A TOTAL OF 1,323,883 MEALS IN 4 WEST MICHIGAN COUNTIES. WHEN INCLUDING THE 664,900 OF VOLUNTEER HOURS, ADJUSTED PROGRAM EFFICIENCY IS 76%. SINCE COVID KFB HAS RESPONDED WITH AN EMERGENCY FOOD PROVISION STRATEGY DISTRIBUTING TO ORGANIZATIONS SERVING LOW INCOME FAMILIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: KIDS HELPING KIDS PROGRAMMING IS THE YOUTH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ARM OF KIDS' FOOD BASKET, PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO ENGAGE IN OUR MISSION AND LEARN ABOUT CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH UNIQUE AND INNOVATIVE LESSON PLANS. APPROXIMATELY A THIRD OF OUR ANNUAL VOLUNTEERS ARE YOUTH UNDER THE AGE OF 18 AND INCLUDE STUDENTS IN AND OUT OF OUR SERVICE LOCATIONS. PROGRAM GOALS INCLUDE YOUTH EMPOWERMENT, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY CONNECTION AND BUILDING THE HABIT OF GIVING, ALL OF WHICH HAVE A LASTING IMPACT ON THE FUTURE LEADERS OF WEST MICHIGAN. YOUTH UNDER THE AGE OF 18 COMPLETED 128 HOURS OF SERVICE THROUGH OUR KIDS HELPING KIDS PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OUR URBAN GROWING AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING PROGRAM IS A RESPONSE TO THE IMMENSE NUMBER OF WEST MICHIGAN RESIDENTS WHO ARE AFFECTED BY FOOD INSECURITY. AN INCREASING NUMBER OF FOOD DESERTS PAIRED WITH EASIER ACCESS TO FAST FOOD AND CONVENIENCE STORES FURTHER LIMITS EQUITABLE ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD CHOICES. KIDS' FOOD BASKET HEADQUARTERS ARE ADJACENT TO THE LARGEST WORKING FARMLAND IN GRAND RAPIDS CITY LIMITS. THE FARM PROVIDES HANDS-ON AGRICULTURAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES, IMPROVES ACCESS TO HEALTHY FOOD CHOICES AND PROMOTES SUSTAINABLE GROWING PRACTICES. FARM YIELD SUPPLEMENTS SACK SUPPERS, PROVIDES FRESH PRODUCE FOR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND PROVIDES ADDITIONAL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES AS WE TEACH MORE PEOPLE THE VALUE OF EQUITABLE ACCESS TO NOURISHING FOOD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL LOBBYING EXPENSES WERE FOR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES. THE ORGANIZATION PAID A MONTHLY FEE TO A LOBBYIST FOR PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISING AND LOBBYING SERVICES, OF WHICH A PORTION WAS CONSIDERED DIRECT LOBBYING EXPENDITURES. NO OTHER EXPENSES WERE INCURRED RELATED TO LOBBYING BY THE ORGANIZATION. THE ORGANIZATION USES THESE SERVICES TO MAKE CONNECTIONS TO BE ABLE TO EDUCATE LEGISLATORS REGARDING FOOD INSECURITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KFB IS THE BENEFICIARY OF A DONOR ENDOWMENT FUND HELD BY THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF MUSKEGON COUNTY, OF WHICH KFB IS ENTITLED TO THE FUND'S SPENDABLE INCOME. THE SPENDABLE INCOME IS TO BE USED FOR THE SUPPORT OF KFB'S MUSKEGON COUNTY LOCATION AND IT'S AFFILIATED AGENCIES.

KFB IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. HOWEVER, INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO KFB'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. GENERALLY, TAX YEARS FROM 2017 THROUGH THE CURRENT YEAR REMAIN OPEN TO EXAMINATION. MANAGEMENT DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT THE RESULTS FROM ANY EXAMINATION OF THESE OPEN YEARS WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL ADVERSE EFFECT ON KFB.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOSS ON SALE OF ASSETS -3,030 FUNDRAISING EVENTS EXPENSE -61,188

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOSS ON SALE OF ASSETS 3,030 FUNDRAISING EVENTS EXPENSE 61,188

PART V, LINE 3A(I) KFB IS THE BENEFICIARY OF A DONOR ENDOWMENT FUND HELD BY THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF MUSKEGON COUNTY, OF WHICH KFB IS ENTITLED TO THE FUND'S SPENDABLE INCOME. THE SPENDABLE INCOME IS TO BE USED FOR THE SUPPORT OF KFB'S MUSKEGON COUNTY LOCATION AND ITS AFFILIATED AGENCIES.

THE RETURN IS BEING AMENDED TO INCLUDE SCHEDULE C LOBBYING INFORMATION. THE SCHEDULE C REPORTING REQUIREMENT WAS DETERMINED AFTER AN INTERNAL REVIEW IDENTIFIED THAT A PROFESSIONAL CONSULTANT ENGAGED BY THE ORGANIZATION WAS REQUIRED TO CONSIDER AND REPORT A PORTION OF ITS FEES AS DIRECT LOBBYING EXPENSES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS INCLUDED THESE FEES AS LOBBYING EXPENSES IN CURRENT FILINGS AND IS AMENDING ALL YEARS IN WHICH THESE FEES WERE APPLICABLE, INCLUDING FISCAL YEARS ENDING 2019, 2020, AND 2021. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT AND DOES NOT PLAN TO PARTICIPATE IN ANY ADDITIONAL LOBBYING ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE OF CONSULTANT RELATIONSHIPS. FORM 990, PART IV, QUESTION 4, WAS UPDATED FROM "NO" TO "YES" TO INDICATE THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES IN LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. SCHEDULE C WAS ADDED AND QUESTION 1I WAS MARKED TO INDICATE THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES IN "OTHER LOBBYING ACTIVITIES". FORM 990, PART IX, WAS UPDATED TO REPORT THESE LOBBYING EXPENSES ON LINE 11D, AND WERE PREVIOUSLY INCLUDED WITH OTHER PROFESSIONAL EXPENSES ON LINE 11G.
ALL LINES LEFT BLANK ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE ORGANIZATION.

AN INDEPENDENT CPA PREPARES THE FORM 990. KIDS' FOOD BASKET FINANCE COMMITTEE, WHICH HAS BEEN DELEGATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTOR, REVIEWS THE RETURN. A DESIGNATED OFFICER SIGNS FORM 8879-EO AUTHORIZING THE CPA FIRM TO E-FILE THE RETURN. THE FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

EACH BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ATTESTING THAT THEY HAVE READ AND AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FURTHER ATTESTING THAT THEY ARE NOT INVOLVED IN ANY ACTIVITIES THAT MAY BE CONSIDERED A CONFLICT EXCEPT AS IDENTIFIED. BOARD MEMBERS EXCLUDE THEMSELVES FROM VOTING ON ANY ACTION ITEMS WHERE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST HAS BEEN DISCLOSED.

THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S TOTAL COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY AT THE CLOSE OF THE FISCAL YEAR BY KFB'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WHICH CONSISTS OF THE ELECTED BOARD CHAIR, VICE CHAIR, TREASURER AND SECRETARY. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE USES CURRENT LOCAL, STATE AND NATIONAL COMPARATIVE NON-PROFIT COMPENSATION STUDIES TO ENSURE FAIRNESS AND COMPETITIVENESS. THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW IS ALSO USED DURING THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION REVIEW. THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW IS COMPILED USING INPUT AND SCORING RECOMMENDATIONS FROM EACH DIRECTOR AGAINST ANNUAL PERFORMANCE TARGETS, METRICS, AND COMPETENCIES. TOTAL COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS ARE DECIDED UPON BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND COMMUNICATED TO THE PRESIDENT AND CEO.

OFFICER TOTAL COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY AT THE CLOSE OF THE FISCAL YEAR BY HUMAN RESOURCES AND THEIR DIRECT SUPERVISORS. KFB USES CURRENT LOCAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL COMPARATIVE NON-PROFIT COMPENSATION STUDIES TO ENSURE FAIRNESS AND COMPETITIVENESS. THE OFFICER'S ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW IS ALSO USED DURING THE ANNUAL COMPENSATION REVIEW. TOTAL COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS ARE DECIDED UPON AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT AND CEO.
KFB'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.
